snippet: Hard-liners in the House may face potential challengers back home, should they back down in the fight against the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: GOP hardliners in House, like Rep Tom Graves of Georgia, may face potential challengers back home, should they back down in fight against Affordable Care Act; Republican insistence of tying financing of federal government to dismantling of healthcare act is being driven by deeply conservative Congressional districts, threatening voter backlash that could cost in future elections.
lead_paragraph: Hard-liners in the House may face potential challengers back home, should they back down in the fight against the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: Conservative Georgia District Urges G.O.P. to Keep Up the Fight
headline.print_headline: In Conservative Georgia District, Calls for G.O.P. to Keep Up the Fight

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
